Reviews.Title: “Great place - excellent value!”
Reviews.Author: welshdom
Reviews.Content: For the money we paid to stay here I can't talk this place up enough! The hotel is located opposite the turn into Celebration, which is a pleasant couple of miles walk. It is really close to Old Town which was only a few minutes walk away and right on the 192 a few miles from the entrance to Disney. So the location is great! The hotel itself was everything we were looking for. Our room was in block 7 on the ground floor facing the pool. We had a lovely new carpet and every room I got a glimpse of in our block seemed to be the same. I should probably mention that we 'upgraded' to a room with a fridge, which was well worth the extra $10 a day. It also had a microwave but we didn't need it. I reckon you've a better chance of a new carpet in the slightly more expensive rooms but that's just my guess. I would ask for one at reception when you check in as the staff were very obliging. The room was large with two double beds and a TV (which wasn't the best quality picture!). The air-conditioning worked well albeit a little noisily. Because it was only April we turned it off at night anyway. The bedding was clean and I saw the housekeeping staff change the outer bedcover when guests had checked out which is always reassuring as I'm not convinced all places do! We had no problems with ants or insects of any kind. The room was cleaned well daily and the towels changed. The hotel has ample parking and consists of blocks of rooms around the pool area. The pool was nice and quite large. There weren't too many sunbeds but it was never busy. There is free wi-fi at the hotel. Initially my iphone only picked it up in reception but for some reason by later in the week I got it at the pool and in my room so don't know whether it was just my phone being difficult! There was breakfast included but we never went as we kept our own things in the fridge. To conclude, I will definitely be going back to the Rodeway. There was nothing not to like and it was so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but not bad”
Reviews.Author: kaydayAlabama
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for immacculate and upscale ... Look elsewhere. But if on a budget. Its a good solid value for the price. Cute grounds. Roomy enough rooms. Micro/fridge. Wifi with great signal. Basicbreakfast but hey its a freebie! Itll get ya full to start the morning. Ac worked well. Beds pretty comfy. The furnishings are a bit worn and the carpet a bit stained. But not nasty. Desk staff was super friendly. No hidden fees. Pool was nice. Didnt see any bugs of any kind.. And I check mattresses seams as soon as I walk in. As long as you arent super persnickety .. I reccommend as a good cheap place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient - you get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: uwwgal21
Reviews.Content: This is the most inexpensive hotel with shuttle I have found in the Disney area. I have stayed there twice now, and will be staying again in a few weeks. The first time, I paid $35 a night with my AAA discount. I just stayed this past Saturday night, and I paid $49 with AAA (Spring break...) The hotel is in a convenient location to restaurants (Waffle House and Ihop are next door, there are several more restaurants down the street within walking distance) and to touristy shops and Walgreens. It also has a free shuttle to and from EPCOT, where you can get on Disney buses or "trains" to the other parks. There is a free breakfast which is very basic, but it is fine. The room itself, well, you get what you pay for. The carpet was fraying and dirty looking. In our last room (8111) there were cobwebs all over the walls. In our first room (5 something...) there were tiny ants in the sink. But, you don't go to Kissimmee to hang out in your hotel room, I suppose! We went to EPCOT on Sunday on the 8:05 shuttle and came back around 9pm. :) Overall, it's fine if you just need a bed to sleep in in a safe location. The beds were indeed clean, as was the bathroom! :)

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location to Disney”
Reviews.Author: disneyrocksFlorida
Reviews.Content: I think this is one of the closest hotels to Disney we have ever stayed besides on the propery! So that was the best thing about this hotel. We had an easy check-in, nice lady. They gave us a smoking room but we had to change that, the next room was not the best. Carpet had a big bulge in it to trip on, and it was very, very basic and dated. It was a $20 room so I was excited to have a bed to sleep on, and a hot shower after being at the Parks all day. No breakfast like they say just muffin and juice. They have free scheduled shuttle to Magic kingdom, and close to parks so it was nice for the fact we stayed out all day. Would stay again just for shower and sleep and cheap room.

Reviews.Title: “Eww”
Reviews.Author: Aidansmommy
Reviews.Content: My son and I just returned from our stay at the rodeway Inn for the holiday weekend. I'm not sure how people could give this place glowing reviews. It was clean enough I suppose but it was dingy,old,worn and just generally a dump. It looks as if it hasn't been updated for decades. The rug was so nasty looking and it was actually so frayed around the edges that the fibers were sticking up in clumps near the bathroom door. There was no microwave or fridge and the t.v got limited channels. The a/c looked as if it hadn't been cleaned in forever and there was even a dead roach in the grating. Breakfast consisted of 3 kinds of cereal, bagels and juice, milk or coffee. No fruit, no yogurt...nothing. Would I ever stay here again? NO! I guess you truly get what you pay for and if it hadn't been for the fact that most of the nicer lower priced hotels were either booked solid or there rates were raised for the holiday...I would have chosen someplace else...I suggest you do the same.

Reviews.Title: “adequate for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: gary m
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there a few times with no major problems. This last trip some towels were missing and coffee "items" hadn't been replaced. One night no fitted sheet for bed, but no problem. Pool area is really nice . Quiet but should have night time security..

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JMHPelham_Ont_
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice on our vacation-January 28/2012 and February 3rd. This a traditional older Disney area hotel - 4 two storey buidings in a cluster surrounding a pool. Restaurant and lobby at front. Check-in was quick and easy, the room although showing it's age was clean with plenty of hot water and decent a/c, one of the comfier beds I've slept in, and there is an excellent continental breakfast included in the rate. There are newer, fancier hotels, but not at $29 per night with breakfast. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and close to amenities.”
Reviews.Author: Tribble-traveller
Reviews.Content: Having stayed there before and found it to be good value for money we decided to do a one night stop over before flying out to New York the next day. Located right at the end of the road to the airport makes it a great location for doing just that. They found us a disabled room at our request on the ground floor which was very helpful. The pool was small but adequate with plenty of loungers and chairs provided.. The breakfast was ample for what we needed. All in all - good value for money at an unpretentious hotel.

Reviews.Title: “internet problems”
Reviews.Author: Bea R
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay at an affordable price but lots of internet problems from my room; lobby is good for computer work if you can stand the TV there...too loud for me, esp. since the couches in that area are right under the television. I would stay here again but would want the WiFi to work in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay with a great value”
Reviews.Author: jennyjr
Reviews.Content: The room was clean and roomy but the bathtub was sinking a bit, the bed were super hard and pillows were very uncomfortable. The location was great close to Disney parks, Gaylord Palms for their December activities and restaurants.Within walking distance from Waffle House, I Hop, Race Track, Golf, Golden Corral and CVS. Overall for the price is not bad at all but we both woke up with pain on our shoulders due to the bed.

Reviews.Title: “A Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Rich850
Reviews.Content: Probably the cheapest accomodation I've ever stayed in, but excellent value. We had no complaints. Rooms were comfortable and kept very clean (one for adults, one for daughter). Both had a fridge and coffee making facilities. Both rooms had 2 double beds. I later found out that a King room was available that even had a small kitchen, which will be my choice for the next time. YES, we will be going back. Very short drive for the Disney Parks and a very good bar/restuarant was also a 10mins walk. Pool was also very welcome after a day in the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 week for a nice Disney getaway. The low price is great but do not expect too much. I would hope the only reason you would stay here is because you want a cheap place to sleep. Nothing more. The resort and in-room safe fees are a joke. If you do stay here, leave super early in the morning and get here super late. Nothing to enjoy while you are here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Accomodations for the bargain price”
Reviews.Author: Lucia D
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay from 23-27 of November, 2011. We were in a non-smoking room - 2714. The location was great for visiting Disney, Hollywood Studios and EPCO. The breakfast had several types of juices, coffee, banana and cup cakes - and it was included in the price of the hotel!!! Double beds that were wonderful. Housekeeping services were excellent and so Maintenance. We had a problem with the sink that was clogged, and we called front desk, and Maintenance came right way and fixed it. I would highly recommend this hotel, because it is inexpensive and in a great location!!! Lucia Daza and Claudio Mothé.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting--stay away!”
Reviews.Author: catwoman13439
Reviews.Content: Where to start? First room had a disgusting, leaky toilet. Second room had doors that wouldn't close, electrical plugs falling out of outlets, sheets so threadbare they felt like tissue paper and a filthy rug. Breakfast was packages of instant oatmeal and bananas. There are creepy people hanging around the outside and the outside perimeter of the motel looks like a slum. The inside courtyard is slightly better and the pool is decent.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel and staff, and pool!”
Reviews.Author: MALCOLMSMOMLuray_va_
Reviews.Content: this hotel was wonderful in every way. not only was it inexpensive, but the rooms were very clean and comfortable, the pool was perfect to swim in and was open early in the morning, when i like to swim. all the staff was so kind and helpful. i will be back at this fantastic budget hotel soon!

Reviews.Title: “Decent motel for the price you pay”
Reviews.Author: mscarano
Reviews.Content: Don't expect a 5 star motel with the 5star service. It's a decent place to stay for the money you pay. It's in a great location, near several restaurants (Cracker Barrel, Waffle house, Golden Corral, Joe's crab shack,etc.), souvenir shops, bars, Walgreens, as well as a 15-20min. ride to Universal Orlando and all the Disney parks. It's within walking distance to Old Town (a '50's-60's era themed area with amusement rides). The motel is fairly kept. It has a pool, vending machines, ample parking, shuttle service to the parks & they provide continental breakfast (which I didn't try). The rooms are very standard with one dresser, T.V., small bathroom, coffee machine, safe, table with 2 chairs and 2 beds. The rooms are carpeted and in my opinion, they need to be thoroughly vacuumed and shampooed. You may end up with a room that has a bit of that old-musty-stale odor, nevertheless, if you are on a budget and need a decent place to stay, then this is the place. If you are looking for a superior motel then look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Rodeway Inn Maingate really gross stay away”
Reviews.Author: rosetta66
Reviews.Content: I travel to the kissimmee area alot since I am a Florida resident and go to Magic Kingdom often. I have stayed at many hotels on Hwy 192 but this place was just nasty. Thank God we only needed to stay for one night. Upon check in the people that were staying there scared me. There was this guy sitting on the steps smoking and he looked dirty and scary. I went to the first room that was supposedly non smoking and it smelled like an old ash tray and urine. There was gum stuck to the carpet on the floor and I think the carpet was supposed to be a burgandy color but it looked black. I went to the front desk and told them the condition of the room and the response was that they were not responsible for what people did in the rooms. The second room was not much better but at least is did not smell like an ash tray and urine. The box spring and mattress were dirty and stained but the sheets were clean. The beds were rock hard. We went out to eat and stayed out late so that we would not have to be in there too long. Yuck what a dump.

Reviews.Title: “This was a surprise”
Reviews.Author: lesorlem
Reviews.Content: Got a deal online (direct) for less than $30 + tax. It is a motel so you cant expect the best.. Free wi-fi, breakfast (muffin, coffee, juice & banana), and transfers which we were not able to use becs we had a car. If you check-in after-hours, its done through the side window. Waffle House is almost next door, IHOP is about a 2-minute walk. There is also a gasoline station next door with a good stock of drinks/food. Staff are friendly and courteous - special mention to Eugene and Leanne! TIP: Get your tickets for the parks through David at the travel desk - excellent rates, he's very helpful, honest and fair! Please note that he's only there in the morning - first come, first serve.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: Adrifx
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was located very near to Disney parks. It provides free shuttle bus with a fixed schedule, but we didn't take the bus because we wanted to go earlier and leave the park later. Rates are excellent, we paid around $26 per night. Hotel staff was very helpful providing any kind of information we asked for. WiFi signal was poor in our room. The room was a little bit dirty, we found some ants. Breakfast consists only in coffee, orange juice, cupcakes and bananas, but we cannot expect more for what we paid. We will probably stay here again if we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Not a total disgrace, but nothing fancy or special either”
Reviews.Author: jojo34219
Reviews.Content: Very economically priced room (63 dollars total for 2 nights, Sat and Sun), we have stayed previously at the Quality Suites on Turkey Lake Road and Quality Inn on Irlo Bronson east of this location and the lousy Comfort Inn on Sand Lake road and Universal Blvd, and for the price, we felt the room was better kept and cleaner than these other "better locations". We did not feel too safe at this location though. so definitely keep your valuables close. Their courtyard and pool area did look nice and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Motel good value free wifi!!!”
Reviews.Author: mchawkins1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here twice lovely rooms with all the facilities the pool is great ... mind u the free breakfast is a bit basic but Denny's or Waffle House are close by.... Plus close to local shops & restaurants of course u need a car but hotel offers free wifi & bus to Disney, first trip I went to Disney but in June & went to Universal Studios wonderful... next trip I will return to Busch Gardens Tampa

Reviews.Title: “more than we need and hope”
Reviews.Author: buccimario
Reviews.Content: very close to disney resort and kennedy space center, great breakfast. staff gentle and friendly. pool open from 9am to 11,30pm. large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: jenmcnitt
Reviews.Content: The Rodeway Inn is a very inexpensive place to stay for a few days while your visiting Disney. It is located very close to the Disney resorts and if you plan on not staying in your room for much other than sleeping, it is worth the price (~$30 a night when I was there). It definitely has some flaws but the room we stayed in was clean and we had no issues with the staff. There is a also a pool area but we did not use the pool. The one thing we did notice though was that our toilet was 'rocky' and that the seal around it needs to be redone. We did eat at the free breakfast and it had everything we needed for a quick breakfast before it was time to visit a park including juice, milk, oatmeal, cold cereals, bananas, bagels, and small muffins. If you are looking for something more substantial, there is an IHOP and a Waffle House close by. Overall if I needed a cheap place to stay in the area, I wouldn't mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!! Management no good at guest relations-Will NEVER recommend”
Reviews.Author: stearns158
Reviews.Content: Will not stay or recommend this hotel again- my wife and I already posted on Facebook to stay away! Charged us for dog fees and we didn't even REMOTELY have dogs near the room- or any other animal- stay or be in the hotel room! But yet we were charged for it. When we booked the reservation on-line we wanted a ground floor room and the only available ones were "pet-friendly" so we reserved a room for us and our two teenage sons. Since we reserved that room they asumed we had pets. Asked front desk to open the big gate that has a sign on it "Busses and trucks please see front desk to open" (We were driving a 26 foot Uhaul with an attached 8 foot tow dolly and van)- Front desk told me to back it up !!!????? Finally after arguing they agreed to open the gate. This location has a driveway shaped like a "U" that goes around the building- so ANY huge vehical- busses, trucks, RV's and U-HAULS cannot back up. Management for this hotel not very good at GUEST RELATIONS (in a depressed economy- are you kidding me). When we were questioning the $140 charged to our card- they said we had pets and were charged $100 for that. After arguing, the General Manager of this location told my wife that maybe we should have stayed somewhere else!!!!! We even invited her down to the room to look at it to see there were no animals. Choice Privileges member- not much longer.

Reviews.Title: “There is no reason to stay anywhere else in the Orlando area.”
Reviews.Author: kayaknbabe
Reviews.Content: If you want to stretch your vacation dollar, stay at this hotel. The staff is very friendly and the value for the price can't be beat. There is a lovely heated swimming pool, with plenty of tables, umbrellas and lounges. The rooms are comfortable. Some rooms are equipped with a fridge and microwave. They also provide a free continental breakfast. This is not the most modern hotel, but they are currently renovating rooms. The location is convenient, the staff is very nice and helpful, there is free high-speed wireless in your room, and I feel this hotel is a fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “call 911”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinHunter
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for a nite on our way to the Keys. Took our overnite bag and laptop case into the room and then went across the street to eat. When we came back our room had been broken into and our things were gone. Called the front desk and 911. Hotel staff took a report and told us they had security cameras but they did not have access to them and the one person who did would not be there until Monday. Cops took a report and showed us the tool marks on the loose fitting door where the theft had popped the door open. He said they did'nt have many thefts in that area but told us not to leave anything in our car overnite. While getting the rest of our luggage from the car we noticed three other doors with the same tool marks. We spent a sleepless nite with a chair under the door handle. Took one look at the breakfast in the morning, grabbed a cup of coffee and got the heck out of there..

Reviews.Title: “I've Had It With This Hotel. Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Luckyboots
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here dozens of nights over the years. I think that the place has changed hands recently, because the rooms used to be clean and the premises, including pool were very nice, including a nice, well heated pool. The past couple of times we had rooms with bare minimum towels, pillows, and just about everything else. We've experienced malodorous conditions in some rooms, insects in others. Our latest room was full of small insects: ants, bedbugs, termites? The water in the sink was plenty hot, unfortunately that's all that we could get to come out of it. Ever try brushing your teeth or washing your hands with what seemed like near scalding water? Oh, the pool, still appears clean, but not nice and warm like it used to be for many years. We know better than to bother with their "free breakfast." Bottom line, cheap is cheap, but sometimes it's just worth it to spend a little more money to get something clean and decent for your family.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: baknedicem
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel from 17th of December to 19th of December 2010. I booked the room from priceline for 24 dollars (tax included) for a day. When I went there they asked me 4 more dollars per day as a service fee. I did not read the terms of agreement carefully but when I checked it again I really saw that the service fee was excluded. If you are planning to visit Seaworld, Disney or Universal, it has a very convenient location. It is just 5 minutes walking distance away from the Old Town. All I can praise for this hotel is the cheapness and the location. The room was incredibly smelly. We tried to open a window but all the windows were sealed. Eventually we got used to the smell (Don’t worry you will do the same when you have to). TV was old(I am guessing that it was the first prototype) and when turned on, it was making a sound that no kind of human being could stand. There was no hairdryer in the room. For me it is no big deal as I am getting bald but my wife was shocked when she found out that there was no hairdryer. In the morning, Only one person can have a shower because the hot water finishes before the second person goes in. I experienced this problem both days. Ahh the breakfast of course. I must say that it was a joke. There is a separate building for the breakfast. In the morning somebody is waiting next to the door and checks if any guests is taking anyting out to the rooms. Don’t fancy anything better. There are only bananas and bagels. I was there for the seaworld, and It was worth to bear this hotel’s conditions just to see the seaworld during Christmas time. My advice, if you are a couple with no children, go to seaworld. If you are married with children, you can also consider Disney besides seaworld. But please stay away from this hotel. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the money it cost”
Reviews.Author: woutje
Reviews.Content: We have had a nice stay. When checked in, first one room was not very clean but they acted real quick and made it clean very fast. I liked the safe, fridge and magnetron in the room. Pitty for the extreem poor breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Nice”
Reviews.Author: Valita_17
Reviews.Content: The rooms are big with microware included. It's parking and breakfast included (only coffe or te but it's OK). It's good to be with low cost near the parks and the outlet. The Pool was no available.

Reviews.Title: “roaches!!!! dont stay here !!!!”
Reviews.Author: wallykil
Reviews.Content: Booked this room way ahead of or trip to disney.And got a great rate.But a fue days before we left I read the reviews on trip adviser and seen a bug problem.I called and was told that 2 workers that were fired sent the reports in to make the hotel look bad.And there were no problems with bed bugs or cockroaches.We went to the room and was there 10 minutes when my wife pulled the pillow up and found cockroaches in the BED.I cought one in a cup and took pictures with my camera phone .Went to front desk and showed the bug to the ast. manager and and left.Will never go back there if the rooms were a dollor a night !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel,Great price”
Reviews.Author: y2quest
Reviews.Content: I must say after reading all the bad reviews I sometimes wonder if i stayed in that same Hotel? All these bad reviews must be from customers with special needs or they must be Picky snobs who aren't happy unless their A** is kissed just right. I saw no Bed Bugs , the room and bathroom were very clean, and the Beds were extremely comfortable and clean as well. They also provided a continental breakfast, not the best choices of food I have seen at a continental breakfast but for the price paid (24.99 a night) I wasn't complaining. It was good enough to fill me till lunch. The front desk clerks were very Polite, helpful and I checked in and out very quickly. For a hotel that charges under 30 a night I got a great bargain and a nice clean place to sleep most hotels for that price charge by the hour and don't change the sheets. This hotel is just minutes away from Disney and there many restaurants that are just within walking distance. My only knock on the place was the ice machine was far from my room and the one closest to me didn't work so i had to walk pretty far from my room to find one that worked.Bottom Line.....It's not the Sheraton or any fancy hotel but it's a clean and comfortable place to sleep and if you don't want to waste a huge part of your vacation budget on a hotel then this place is for you. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ludwig23
Reviews.Content: So I went to this very crappy hotel due to the price! and guess what!!! I wake up covered with bed bugs ! all over my body!!! disgusting!!! I have red itchy bumps on my back, hands, feet!...I should had pay a little bit more, this place smells, is horrid, the AC broke, it had this musty smell... DO NOT TRUST GOOD REVIEWS! please stay somewhere else!..

Reviews.Title: “If you care about your children, stay elsewhere!!”
Reviews.Author: miike78
Reviews.Content: I know. This is a 30$-per-night motel. But I also think that you need minimum hygenical conditions if you want to have a decent staying. This place lacks in hygene in so many ways that are impossible to enumerate, from the multicolored-stained moquette, to the molded bathroom, to bugs of all kinds into the room. But the quality is bad overall: poor service, poor breakfast, poor security, poor and cramped pool. I was there with a friend for one night, so we decided to stay and use our sleeping bags. But if you have children, PLEASE, PLEASE consider spending a few dollars more (there are a LOT of alternatives in the area) and stay elsewhere, because they could get hurt or ill in so many ways you can't even imagine.

Reviews.Title: “HAS ROACHES”
Reviews.Author: deladav
Reviews.Content: They are Real Roaches. They are not water bugs as the Motel suggested. Do not let the Motel fool you into believing otherwise.you would not believe the things that happened during my2 night stay here. 1. Someone was getting arrested outside the hotel when I was checking in. 2. They gave us the keys to an occupied room. Imagine if this happened to your room? What if the ones that got your room key stole everything???? Do you want to take this chance? 3. There were roaches, not water bugs, not bed bugs, Roaches!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs to wake you followed up by poor service and poor breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: tree516
Reviews.Content: During my families stay we found that the continental breakfast was quite limited with poor choice of two items with stale taste. The room condition was quite poor and am in shock it has passed inspection at all. I only found one employee to be the least bit kind, the remaining were short, rude and not helpful. The most appauling is that our room had bed bugs. We thought it was the sheets but in fact it was bed bugs! My family has went to our doctor upon return home and the doctor confirmed our disturbing suspitions and suggested we throw out or bleach everything we brought back to avoid getting them in our home!!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews - this place is excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: HappyDad71
Reviews.Content: My wife, 2 kids (age 7 and 3) and I stayed here in July 2010. We had previously stayed here in 2008. It remains an outstanding value for a Florida vacation! Rooms are large and clean. We had a poolside room with a fridge and microwave, which was convenient. The pool is one of the best we have ever encountered - warm, large and clean. Service is EXCEPTIONAL!!! Both check in and check out were excellent. Breakfast was served in a large clean meeting room and there was great variety. The location cannot be beat as it is minutes from Disney. Beds are clean and comfortable. We paid 5 times more than the Rodeway Inn for other parts of our stay in Orlando, and got much less than what the Rodeway Inn offered. It is an older property but is well-maintained and clean. The grounds are beautiful. It is a great place to stay and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for your Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: Davyboy75
Reviews.Content: We booked this room based on the previous reviews of other TripAdvisor travelers and we were not disappointed. You can't beat the price and location. The rooms were very clean and the staff is friendly, helpful, and hardworking. Because we booked are room for under $30 per night, we were able to stay longer and take our time at Disney World. We booked a poolside room which had a microwave, refrigerator, and coffeemaker. We were very comfortable for our whole 10-day stay. The grounds are landscaped nicely. The pool is large and popular and can get a bit noisy at night. However, the noise was a minor issue. As other reviewers mentioned, the breakfast consists of snacks, coffee, and juice, which was sufficient for us since we stocked up our refrigerator. Lastly, on a very positive note, my wife forgot her blow dryer. Our room did not have one, so the desk clerk ( I regret I didn't get her name) offered to let my wife use her own personal blow dryer. Now that's service! This place is not the Marriott or the Hilton, but if your looking for a safe and clean place to sleep after a long day at the theme parks, this is the place. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “EWW, EWW, EWW!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: reeeniiee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I planned on a nice 2-3 day getaway. We were going to Epcot and the hotel was less than 3 miles from the attraction. I searched many sites for cost, availability, and ease of access to certain attractions. I booked a 2 night 3 day stay 3 weeks prior to rservation. We were confirmed for a King with kitchenette 7/22-7/24. On the day we arrived our accomadations were not avaiable. The front desk agent said there was only a room with a double bed. I questioned the fact that our confirmation was for the king and how was that not to be honored? The gentlemen whose name was Leo ( he was pleasant) called a supervisor to see if anything could be done. A woman approached and looked up some info on the computer and said " We have a room with double beds available." Again I questioned the fact that the confirmed reservation was not avaiable. With some more "searching" a room with a king bed was found. After arriving in our room the outward appearance was OK. We left our things in the room and went out to enjoy the area. The next morning I awoke to SEVEN roaches in various parts of the room and EWW, EWW, EWW got out as fast as we could! We cut our stay short and I really hope the front desk took my alert to heart to FUMIGATE that room. I really hope no one needed to see the creepy crawlies as I did. The place should be the ROACH INN Maingate, Kissimee Fl.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed for 9 days. Don't trust the good reviews.”
Reviews.Author: Hawkfan38020
Reviews.Content: I am not a picky traveler, but this hotel was horrid. Check in took about 20-30 minutes per person. Our room key was de-magnetized when we went to the pool so we stood in line for 30 minutes waiting for a new key. I finally had to interrupt one of the clerks (yes, there were 2. Did I mention how slow check in is?) otherwise we would have waited for well over an hour. The carpet was so awful that I didn't feel comfortable going without shoes. We could hear anyone and everyone walking by outside. The hotel told us there was security on property, but we never saw them. The pool is great for older kids and adults because it's 4+ feet deep. Our trip was primarily for Disney, but the transportation was the biggest problem. This hotel offers free shuttles, and these were another big problem. Our return shuttle drivers were always confused about whether or not they should be picking up people for our hotel. They actually forced a group to get on the wrong bus, and they ended up having to take another shuttle from a different location when they discovered the error. They finally returned to the hotel 2 hours later. This hotel is about a 5 minute car ride from the Disney parks and it took our driver 45+ minutes to drive us home. He also was incredibly rude to the family next to us. He had packed so many of us on the bus on one trip that their daughter was sick at one of the stops. As she was vomiting outside at the front of the bus, the driver began laughing at her. When they asked his name he wouldn't give it. He kept telling them that he wouldn't allow them to give a bad report about him. I told them to take his picture and a pic of the bus number before getting off. They did. Our hotel manager was sympathetic but continued to use the same service during our stay. Another driver took us to a hotel that wasn't on the route and hung out there for an additional 10 minutes waiting for someone. Then, this family approached and slipped the driver some twenties and got on the bus. It's all very shady. Breakfast was coffee and wrapped donuts in a dirty hallway. The tub always had chemicals sitting in it every time housekeeping left. A majority of the guests here were trashy and ghetto. We won't be staying there again. I actually am so turned off by the public transportation in Kissimmee that I will only drive a rental car or use Disney transportation in the future. I picked this hotel because it had good ratings and low price on Travelocity. Don't trust them---this place definitely wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Dirt Cheap, and That's the Best Thing About It”
Reviews.Author: Publius2003
Reviews.Content: I recently blind booked this through Hotwire. I got a rate of $19 plus tax, so I wasn't expecting much. Seeing the mixed reviews on here made me think that I should make a backup refundable reservation at another hotel, which I did, but I didn't need to use that and ended up at this hotel. The hotel is located very close to Disney, and has a shuttle service available. I saw many people using that service, so it must be reliable. I was just passing through town, so I didn't use that service. The lobby was immaculately clean. Check in was OK, but I did notice on the statement I signed that I was to be charged a fee of $1.70 for use of a safe. I was able to have that fee removed, since I didn't need the safe; however, I was not able to remove the $2.50 charge for the shuttle. Still, I thought that was reasonable, since I usually pay double that at area Kissimmee hotels. The buildings appear to be at least thirty years old, and have the outdoor walkways which were common in the 80's. The rooms were very clean, but very beaten up. When I arrived in the room, I pulled off the bed sheets and checked for bed bugs, which is something I do routinely when I check into a hotel. I did not see bed bugs, but I saw very old, stained mattresses which were coming apart at the seams. Also, I found large clumps of dirt on top of one of the mattresses, which had been concealed by the bedsheets. Also, the beds were not that comfortable. My wife and I spent the night on the "cleaner" set of mattresses. In the morning, I checked out the "breakfast", which consisted of prepackaged donettes, a coffee machine (which is not kept out all day), and room temperature grocery store orange and apple drink (not juice). We went elsewhere for breakfast. I found the wifi to be excruciatingly slow. I did not check out the pool, but saw that many families were using it. Overall, given the low rate we paid, we weren't disappointed. If someone is seeking the cheapest possible clean room for Disney, then I would recommend this place. The hotel was at near capacity, so it has no problem moving its rooms at this price point. However, in hindsight, I believe most would wish they paid the few extra dollars to be elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “great place,for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: wallykil
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 2 nights in may .And found this place to be well worth the money. Less then 25.00 a night.Room was clean and comfortable.And the grounds were well kept.Employes were frendly and helpful.Fast check in and check out.close to old town and disney.I will definately be back.Celabration is just across the road and has many great shops and resturants.And an I hop with in walking distance.I have been coming to disney area for 10 years and find this hotel well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, convenient to Disney and very easy on the budget.”
Reviews.Author: Kismet1439
Reviews.Content: No issues with this motel. Room was very clean and everything worked. Had a "smoking" room but there was no stale oder at all. Five minutes to Disney entrance. Breakfast was convenience store type packaged mini donuts but Waffle House is steps away. Stayed one night and concluded it is a great place if all all you need is a clean, bug free room and a shower. Besides the pool, there may not be enough to entertain kids but adults on a budget will find it more than adequate. Don't know about other Roadway Inns but this one is worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: familyfun68
Reviews.Content: I was completely unsure of this hotel after reading the reviews, but i wanted a vacation for my boys and this is what we could afford so i took the chance. We had an awesome experience, we arrive April 19th at about 12am, Angus the front desk clerk was great! Very friendly and welcoming. He checked us in and i prayed all the way to the room that it just be clean. I could not be more surprised, Not only was it clean, but for 30 bucks a night, it was really nice. Comfy beds, soft new pillows, nice big tv, and an ac that was working perfectly. The shuttle times are a little off, if you want to leave early, but if you you walk to the front of the hotel look to the left, right in front of the gas station is the Lynx city bus stop. They come every 20 minutes, #56 takes you to Disney, then if you want Seaworld #50 from Disney. For me my ,18yr old and 8 yr old it was $11.50 for a day pass, meaning you can ride any bus all day for that price. The breakfast buffet was ok, they had fresh juice, coffee, donuts and pastry. They do come in little packages like you get at the store, but again. For 30 bucks a night it was great. The pool is awesome, big and heated. Laundry room helped keep our need for a lot of clothes to pack minimum. We had one night through our 7 night stay where a guest with a motorcycle was being loud and abnoxious, we called right away and security immediately took care of it. I am extremely pleased with our stay there and will definately be back again...

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: diversdenstaff
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews b4 calling. took a chance on a buget hotel and it paid off big time. Called and spoke with Claudia, who was very polite, she informed me that there were no standard non-smoking rooms left, but she offered to upgrade me to a deluxe room for the same price, which i thought was nice. We were only there for one night before checking into a disney resort, but the room was clean, very close to the parks and way more affordable than the resort. We had a room right next to the pool, it was very quite. we paid less than $40 for the night. In a town like Orlando, it's hard to pick where to stay, but i would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “definately would stay here for a Disney trip”
Reviews.Author: StPete-Rhonda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not very far at all from the Disney Parks entrance and easy to find. The room rate VERY affordable. The room was very good, clean, the pillows comfy. They have a shuttle to the Disney parks- so saved us the $14 parking fee there. The staff was very very nice. The listed breakfast is just juice, coffee/tea, and mini-doughnuts; but there are many restaurants and stores near by. We will stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Bad Bad Bad”
Reviews.Author: Elizabethd2010
Reviews.Content: This is the worse place ever.... My rooms got robbedi lost every thing. Front desk and or manager was no help. im still fighting with them 3weeks later for over charging my credit card for fake charges

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: josesmommy
Reviews.Content: For the price we paid, my expectations weren't real high. When I got there I was pleasantly surprised. The room was very clean and comfortable. The bed's were awsome! The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous. The pool area was huge and very well kept. It was too cold when we were there to enjoy it though. Overall, a great place to stay for the money. Also, I didnt expect it, but there was a microwave and refridgerator in our room. The location cannot be beat especially for Disney. We used the shuttle, which was a huge help and it saved us some money cause we didnt have to pay at disney to park. It was nice and quiet there too. The hotel looks a little old, but still a great place to stay. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lower than expectation for Choice's hotels”
Reviews.Author: travelgal209
Reviews.Content: The room was OK but the door was a bit difficult to locked so we have to put the table behind the door to feel safer. The breakfast that they offered was the tiny pastries with coffee and juices. At least, there was coffee and juices. The Wi-fi was not working inside the room so my friend had to go down to the lobby and used it. However, it was not that fast neither. It took her about 15 minutes to open a web page. The location was the great part as the hotel is close to Disney World which was the reason we came down there for. If you want to look for a low budget hotel for a night or two, this could be an OK place.

Reviews.Title: “For less than $29.99 night, stop complaining!”
Reviews.Author: zzixor1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Rodeway Inn (5995 Rte 192, not the other one) on and off for over a month. We are relocating to Florida and need an inexpensive and decent Hotel/Motel for us and our pets. Some of the reviews on this website are not this hotel but another Rodeway Inn down the rode so beware. This hotel is perfectly fine for anyone who wants to spend less than $30 a night. What do you expect for that? Well I expected a clean room, simple service and to be very close to attractions, restaurants and highways. I am getting exactly what I am paying for. If you need fancier towels, interior hallways and brand name donuts for breakfast, then stay somewhere else. Its $30 people..! It has been very quiet, clean and maid service has been excellent. Sure the hotel is a bit older, its been here awhile. The rooms are very basic, little outdated but simple. Bathrooms need an overhaul but again its $30..! Bottom line, its good for the price and plenty close to Disney. If you need Mickey Mouse soap and a 100 channels on the TV then go somewhere else. This is basic hotel living.

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovemyenglishbulldog
Reviews.Content: Never again! Our rooms were robbed~ lost everything. Hidden fees, nothing worked (lights, laundry, etc) trash piled up~ shady characters.

Reviews.Title: “Horriibe trip will stay in a better Hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: MICKEY22Florida
Reviews.Content: Would never stay thir again was over changed on my bank card it was a big hassle to get the money back I had to call my bank to get it done, I was changed for a room I never had I dont know what thir was thinking one person could stay in two rooms. It was hard to find someone that know what thir was doing it end up I left to come home a day ahead cause I did not want more changes on my card I plan on staying at a better hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - Best location”
Reviews.Author: lshaikh
Reviews.Content: After reading lot of reviews we were reluctant to stay at this hotel. Thought of atleast trying out for a night or two and ended up living for 5 nights. The main reason to choose this hotel was the location since it was close to all Disney and other parks. The second reason was they had a full kitchen and it was very handy for cooking late dinner after a long day at the park and for early breakfast. Walmart was within 5-7 minutes drive and other restaurants were within walking distance that made our stay very convenient. We had 2 young children 11& 9 and was able to accomodate all 4 of us and had a decent size kitchen. The carpet felt little soggy and the floors in the bathroom and kitchen were dirty. Overall a managaeble place if keep you your expectations to minimum. The front desk was very helpful and attended to our requests promptly. The internet connection was working only in the lobby area. We never tried the free breakfast. The pool was nice and clean but the water was not heated but with 70+ F in November it was quite comfortable. If you have small children we recommend to look for a better and clean hotel. We may stay at Rodeway Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Grounds and Pool, Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: thecrusader
Reviews.Content: My family and I traveled to Florida this past summer, and stayed in seven Choice Hotel affiliated partners. One of the them was the Rodeway Inn in Kissimmee, Florida where we stayed for two nites in August. Our experience at this location was not the lounging we expected from a Choice Hotel. It was rather quite disturbing. The counter staff were mostly rude, unprofessional, and lacked common sense and common courtesy.. We found cockroaches in the room, had hot water in the sink and shower and no cold water,. It was a miseralbe experience. Although, the price was right and the popular attracations were minutes away by car, you may want to consider staying at a higher end hotel or a nearby resort if you can afford it. I admit the pool was admirable, clean and huge but the water levels were inaccurate causing a possible risk. The pool was overflowing with an estimate of 6 inches over the labeled depth, for example, 6 feet was actually 6 ft 6 inches and so on along the perimeter.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel for vacation”
Reviews.Author: familyVacation4u2
Reviews.Content: I must say after reading the reviews I was afraid to stay at this hotel. The hotel wasn't as bad as everyone was saying. The rooms were clean and it was great for the budget the money I saved staying here I used to treat my kids at Disney and the other parks around Orlando. I would definite stay again with my family. The kids had fun everyday they went swimming after being at the parks during the day. The only gripe I had was the internet was non exisient you had to walk to the hotel lobby if you wanted to use your laptop just for internet access and half the time the hotels router was down. But overall I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unliveable disgusting”
Reviews.Author: pocopons
Reviews.Content: when we arrived from a 16hr drive the front desk clerk was very rude and unprofessional. once we got our room it had a horrible odor as if the carpets were wet and never dried. the bathroom floor was disgustingly dirty and at 6am in the morning the bathroom ceiling started to leak. there was no internet connection like advertised. i do not recommend this place to anyone its in horrible condition and we were supposed to stay there for a week, we stayed for one night and went someone else and the front desk clerk did not even ask why we were leaving ahead of time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BigLouis
Reviews.Content: First of all after reading the other reviews I asked Thomas Cook to change the hotel but they refused to change us. I am now glad they did not change us. The hotel is very good for the price paid, Its in a great location near supermarkets and the Old Town which has music on most nights free. The rooms are clean. You have TV, fidge and microwave. Ask for a second floor room as lower rooms in block 7 tend to floood with the heavy rain. The only bad thing is the reception staff who are very slow and not very helpful at any time. There is only one on duty at any time and take their time and you can wait up to a half hour or more to be served. Buses are handy outside the hotel. The breakfast is only a bun and a drink of coffee or orange juice, Overall a good hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel near Disney”
Reviews.Author: CoasterSue
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel based on the price and proximity to Disney. Since we would only be spending a couple hours sleeping in the room, we didn't need anything fancy. Not that it was extremely bad, but we probably wouldn't stay here again since there's many other hotel choices in this area. The door to the room was very flimsy and probably could've easily been pushed open even when locked if someone really tried. Their ice machice was also out of order and we were told to go next door to the HoJo for ice since that hotel was also under their ownership. Check-out was a chore as we were paying for the bill with Choice hotel certificates which were given to us based on another poor hotel stay. As is always the case, the clerk had no idea how to process it and couldn't do anything until the manager came in hours later. They wound up charging the entire amount to our credit card at that time, but they did credit off the amount of the certificate without further contact. So, although it did get corrected, it was a hassle that never should've happened.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good quality low budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: linnyloo767
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a low budget hotel near to Disney this is the place for you! Stayed at the Rodeway Inn on December 21st 2008 and payed just $43 for the night (inc. tax) Found the hotel pretty easily despite our directions stopping 0.7 miles away from where the hotel was actually located. Checked in with no problems and went straight to the room. On opening the door we were greeted with the smell of old cigarette smoke - not the nicest smell to enter a room to. One of the lights did not work in the room but otherwise everything was clean and worked well. Overall the staff were fairly helpful. Rang the front desk to ask what time the Magic Kingdom opened the next day and the person I spoke to was non-forthcoming so I went to reception the next day and spoke to the woman selling the theme park tickets who was extremely helpful. Was a bit disappointed with the "continental breakfast" which consisted of donuts and orange juice, but then I wasn't expecting much. Best thing about this hotel is it's location! Literally a couple of miles from Disney. Took us probably 10-15 minutes to get to the Magic Kingdom carpark from there. Also it is located on a busy street with plenty of bars and restaurants. Overall I was impressed with the hotel and would probably stay there again if I needed a low budget hotel near Disney and Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “yucky filthy grossness”
Reviews.Author: NVmyrarity
Reviews.Content: before we even go to the place, we got lost from the directions the lady from the inn gave to us. When we got there we had to pay a $6 fee for just having the room, which we booked online and said nothing about it. being that my sister was frustrated from the trip up and the extra charge, she locked the keys of the car inside. They gave us a hanger and were very rude, trying to push us out of the lobby. When all was done, we finally went to our room. It was filthy! the room looked as if it was barely clean. I found hair in a multiple of towels, one ice machine was broken and the a/c made me sick the next day... all in all, I really did not like this place and will not stay there again, even for the price, which was very cheap. the only good thing about this place is that it was right next to a bunch of shops and the amusement parks....

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: fsdsheila
Reviews.Content: OK 4 a budget hotel. Hotel adds $2.50 per day for being located n a resort area. They do not advertise this, nor does it make sense. Shuttle is $10 per day roundtrip to disney. I suggest renting or driving your car. All the parks are close & easy 2 get to. But not walking distance. Slight electrical problems in hotel. Rooms not the cleanest, but OK. Pool, clean. Tons of stores & restuarants on same street, & in walking distance. Probably would not stay here again. Saw a few bugs towards end of stay. Rather just spend the $ for a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: slytclearwater
Reviews.Content: Since we are in Clearwater, we decided at the last minute to go to Universal Studios. We couldnt find a "cheap" hotel near Universal so we decided to stay on 192/Irlo Bronson Mem. Hwy. We picked this hotel just because of the price. We stayed June 27 and 28. Our price was $33 + tax per night. We arrived around 530pm and were able to check right in. They put us into a room on the ground floor overlooking the pool. When I reserved this hotel, I knew not to expect much since it was a really old hotel. Jokingly I even told a friend on the phone who lives in Orlando that we were checking into our roach motel. We were very surprised when we walked into our room. The carpet is on the newer side. The walls looked like they had been painted within the last few months or so. I checked the bathroom for mold and did not find any. The only thing wrong in the bathroom is that the cover on the drain kept coming off. Kinda hard to keep our 3 yr old from it. I did not find any insects around the room at all. I also checked our beds for bedbugs and did not find any. The bedding was not that uncomfortable. We sleep on a pillowtop at home, so I am a mattress snob and this one was not that uncomfy. First night we were startled awake b/c someone prank knocked on our door at 3am. Only one small little complaint is on Sunday we were getting our things together, eating breakfast, and getting ready. We heard a knock on the door around 930am and then the door was immediately opened. My husband rushed to the door and saw that it was the maid. He told her in english that we were leaving soon. She didnt understand and said something in spanish, so my hubby started talking to her in spanish. She apologized and left. There were a lot of places around, restaurants and stores, and it is very close to Disney. I would stay again if it were for a night or two, but not any longer than that. It was ok, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK.”
Reviews.Author: DerekJM
Reviews.Content: As all reviews have stated...this property is good value for the price..so I'll just break this down into pros and cons.. Pros... -inexpensive and good location -clean -good pool -giftshop on premises, near to a Walgreens etc. Cons -reserved a non-smoking, was put in smoking and told all rooms have ashtrays provided...(right.) -insects in original room/bed (silverfish and bedbugs) -furniture in replacement room in disrepair (broken table leg) -depending on staff, either complete indifference or friendly with decent manners..but more often the indifference.. -property is very run-down and desperately needs some updating of fixtures..outlets are lose and broken.. -website says there are inroom safes..my 1st room had a broken one, the one I moved to after the bugs had a keylock with no key... -website says inroom computer hook-up...the front desk said to pull out the phone cord from the phone?!? You *can* get wireless if not in building 7 ( don't allow them to place you in this building) and in the lobby. -the shuttle...*now this is a con* 50mins late first day,40 mins the second...uses an old retired citybus with plank seats..p/u goes everywhichway and takes @ an hour 1/2 to get to the parks. Also you get to pay $10 for this experience...last January 08 this service had a decent coach bus and was complementary, so this is a definite change for the worse. If you are more than a single guest, rent a car..the shuttle service is truly shameful...

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay at great price”
Reviews.Author: indianladynewarkDE
Reviews.Content: It was great place to stay at arond $50 per night in a room having full kitchen. Kitchen had full refridgerator, full four burner electric with oven and a coffee maker, all the needed kitchen gadgets & dishes and utensils. I wish they had a dishwasher, so that there will not be anything you miss in the kitchen. Clean room, good enough beds. Nice toilet with all the toileteries. The swimmingpool seemed to be nice though we did not get chance to use it as we were out all the 7 days for theme parks. Just returned from there & thought to write review as I had read some bad reviews & I was really worried. But the place is great. Go ahead & book it.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as reviews made it seem...”
Reviews.Author: nena747
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for memorial day and overall everything went well. I also had a dog and he's a lab mix which I thought would be crazy taking along but it turned out to be ok. They only charged me an extra 10 dollars for 2 nights for the 42 pound dog which I thought wasn't bad at all. Check-in was fast and easy. Once into the room, it was better than we expected. We could tell that the rodeway inn had apparently been remodeled because the carpet was new...the walls looked repainted and the tub looked new as well. The cleanliness overall of the room was about an 8 out of 10. Don't judge by the outside of the building because the outside is a little older. The pool seemed to be the center of attention even though we didn't get a chance to enjoy. I would definitely recommend and would stay here again. It was cheap and was close to everything. We went to seaworld and it only took about 15 minutes to get there. You can also walk to Old Towne which is about half a mile down the street.

Reviews.Title: “mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: onemom22
Reviews.Content: This is a run-down hotel with worn out accommodations and questionable cleanliness, but it's not without redemption. The good: the pool is great - it's very large, heated, and open long hours. The grounds are very well-maintained. It's very close to all the Disney parks - took us under 10 minutes driving from the hotel to being parked at Disney. There are tons of stores and restaurants very close by. Our room had a microwave and mini-fridge. There were on-site laundry facilities. The staff were all friendly if I was friendly to them - I kept in mind that they're probably getting paid very little to work in this dumpy hotel and deal with unhappy guests all the time. And this place is cheap. The bad: Although friendly, the maid who cleaned our room could not understand spoken or written English, so when I asked for extra blankets and pillows, nothing happened. Many appliances wouldn't stay plugged in because the plugs were old and worn out. Clock didn't work. Mattresses were in sorry shape. "breakfast" is a little package of mini-donuts and a cup of juice or coffee. People in the lobby and other places in the area will try to sell you discounted tickets if you do some kind of time-share thing, which of course we didn't do. The ugly: Although it was mostly cleaned, everything was so run down it seemed dirty. Moldy old bathroom - mold under the toilet rim. But the ugliest was the "free shuttle" to Disney. It took over an hour to get there, very crowded, and you have no choice but to go back to the hotel at the one time they come and get you - doesn't matter if your children are worn out and crying at 7:00, you're not getting a shuttle back until 9:15. Of course, you know this up front, but you might not realize just how tired and cranky your whole family can be by 7:00 after walking in the sun and waiting in lines for the whole day. Do yourself a favor and just pay the $11 for parking - the Disney park roads are EXCELLENT, all marked well and very organized. You can bring all the stuff you want in your car instead of lugging it onto a crowded bus for an hour and you can leave whenever you feel like it. We took the shuttle the first day, then drove and paid for parking the next four. So this place was pretty run-down and the mattresses were uncomfortable, but it did have it's perks. And really, anybody who expects a lot for $40 a night is fooling themselves anyway. I wouldn't stay there again just because the room seemed so dirty (I wouldn't let the kids sit on the floor), and I wouldn't recommend it, but it wasn't so bad that it ruined our vacation or anything.

Reviews.Title: “Good bargain, great location”
Reviews.Author: ajsnskool
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Orlando - spent 8 nights at the Rodeway Inn Maingate in Kissimmee and have to say I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel. The rate per night was just under $50 so you never really know what to expect. We arrived late on Friday night and the hotel desk staff was processing 2 other guests in front of me. The check in process went very quickly, the staff was very friendly and I was out in about 7 minutes (good considering 2 guests in front of me). The room was a good size with 2 double beds, 2 dressers, a table, TV/remote in good working condition and a small bathroom with tub and shower. The beds themselves were comfortable (alittle on the soft side but ok) but the pillows were flat...I used 2 and that worked just fine. The only "problem" I had was I had requested a mini-refrigerator in my room (which does cost an extra $5 a night) and there was none in the room. No big deal...I called the front desk and one was sent right up. We did notice a fairly good sized pool near our building but my son and I were too tired to go swimming at night after full days in the theme parks...the good news was there were constantly people swimming so I imagine it was pretty good. Housekeeping staff was very friendly and did a good job. The room was clean as were all the linens and towels everyday. As for location, you can't beat it unless you're staying on Disney property. We were literally 2.5 miles from the DIsney parks, 10 miles from Universal Studios (I-4 is 1/2 mile away), and Sea World was 6 miles. We also spent a day at the Kennedy Space Center which turned out to only be a 45 - 50 minute ride. The hotel is on Irlo Bronson Highway so you're surrounded by hundreds of restaurants, clubs, shops, supermarkets, fast food places and you are virtually across the street from Old Towne. (BTW, don't use the Goodies supermarket 2 blocks away for anything, they're RIDICULOUSLY overpriced. Drive the mile in the other direction to the Publix!) Overall, this was a great bargain, particularly if you're planning on spending most of your time in the theme parks. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it for families especially.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: haznpapo
Reviews.Content: We went to florida for a week in mid-August and It was the worst time to go. It was raining the whole time. We bought tickets to Universal Studios and couldn't even enjoy them because of the rain. So we spent the whole week in our room. The lady in the front desk was so rude from day one. She ignored us when we went to check in as if we were invisible and any questions we asked she would sigh and roll her eyes with an attitude like she was too busy to answer me. We had booked our room online and everything was taken care of when we got there. Our room had a kitchen and a bathroom. All the rooms were small and a little smelly but ok for the price. The Tv was messed up in our room and we had to call the front desk twice before some one showed up to "try" to fix it. After a while he got it to work but it was really staticy and had tape on it holding the cable cord on the tv. We traveled with our two year old daughter so it was nice when they lent us a portable crib (no charge) which was nice. We couldn't enjoy the pool because of the rain but it looked pretty nice. All in all it was ok. You get what you pay for. Cheap service, cheap room. Great Price.

Reviews.Title: “great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Bob984
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, I was a bit aprehensive. However, my room was fine. All was in good shape, in working order, and clean. The motel is older, but the grounds seemed well-maintained. I got a great price, and a comfortable room that met my needs. For budget travelers like me, it was a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Siroco
Reviews.Content: We stay for only one night, but the general experience was quite good. The reception desk was well staffed (at 11:00 PM) and they were quick and polite, so was check out, very fast. The rooms were clean and fairly new, good beds, so-so linens, rather small TV set, even the rug was fairly clean (for hotels standards), the bathroom was clean with no visible signs of mold at all (sorry, no hairdryers or irons). The rooms are bigger than other motels. Of course the free breakfast was a joke (what do you expect for the price of the room, around $41 with all taxes and fees) just coffee, watered down orange juice and some muffins and mini doughnuts, but it works (they have a Waffle House next door for more substantial breakfasts at an affordable price). The location is a winner, no more than 1 mile from I-4, 5 minutes from the main entrance to Disney World and 10 minutes to Downtown Disney and the Lake Buena Vista area... If you are going to spend 2 to 4 nights in the Orlando area and are going to visits the Disney parks all you need is a clean room for the night (you will be too tired to do anything else), this motel is your best bet. If you are spending more time in Orlando you will need a hotel with more frills, so look elsewhere. I MYSELF WILL GO THIS MOTEL AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the money”
Reviews.Author: jhg155
Reviews.Content: We decided two days beforehand to go to Orlando and Disney. I had enough choice points for a free night at this rodeway. I got the remaining three nights for 35.00 per night. When we arrived there was a little confusion over the free night stay probably because Choice just started dealing with rodeway. We were assigned a room and when we got to it the maid was still cleaning (4:20 p.m.) She said (or at least I think she said in very broken English) that the room "no ready for long time". Back to the front desk we went. They apologized and upgraded our room for free (with fridge, micro, and better view of pool). Room was older but clean and in fairly good shape. Maid service was quite good. Beds were tolerable. Water pressure was not very good and I spent more time trying to adjust the water temperature than actually bathing since any water use in a 10 room radius greatly affected the temp. "Continental Breakfast" was coffee, juice and little packs of mini donuts that we snagged for snacks in the parks. We ate breakfast in one of the buffets down the street. The pool looked good but since it was 35 degrees f. most of our stay, we stayed dry. Overall a decent, safe, hotel for the money. What do you expect for $35 dollars a night, Disney? If all you're gonna do there is sleep, give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Quiet & A Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DannyFL
Reviews.Content: The motel is close to Disney. The room was clean and quiet. The bed was comfortable. It is excellent for the budget minded traveler. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the price.”
Reviews.Author: mazparty
Reviews.Content: The room we had was a little old you could tell, but was clean. It had the basics you would need for just an overnight stay which is all we needed it for. They say they had a continental breakfast but all it actually was, were those mini-donuts you would buy at a convenience store and some orange juice. I wouldn't suggest this hotel for more than a one night stay; but for something cheap that doesn't remind you of a roach motel the Rodeway Inn did the the job.

Reviews.Title: “VERY satisfied”
Reviews.Author: elchaps
Reviews.Content: Hi, first, i was really afraid of this hotel with all the bad reviews from tripadvisor. I have stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and loved the hotel. For the half-price of a comfort-in or quality inn, you can't go wrong. The room was clean, there were no "bugs" or urine smelling... Shower and toilet were clean, everything was really great. Don't forget that this hotel is VERY big, over 200+ rooms in 5 blocs with the pool in the middle. Very close to Disney or Universal. There is a marketplace near the hotel. Seriously, if you wanna go to Disney, and your looking for a cheap hotel to sleep quietly, don't waste your time searching. Negative points: No Coffee maker or Air Dryer in room. BRING your own and save $ ............ In one week, i went to 2 Rodeway inn,. 1 subarban, 1 days in and 2 quality inn all over the US East Coast. The maingate was the cheaper and one of the best hotel we had.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but beware”
Reviews.Author: Bluebeam
Reviews.Content: Our stay itself was pleasant enough and the room was okay for the money. But the hotel advertises for a free continential breakfast, a mini refrigerator in the room, and free internet access. None of those were actually true. We came down to get the "free continental breakfast" about fifteen minutes before the scheduled allowed time would expire and the staff was very nasty about the whole thing and kept hissing that the breakfast station was closed. Not having anything the previous night we grabbed the tiny loaf that they had yet to put away and left to go down the street for breakfast. Also there was no refrigerator in our room at all and when we asked the desk about it they just shrugged thier shoulders and looked away. For internet access may I suggest that you bring your own comuter. There is no computer in the lobby and when you ask the front desk they say, "We have no internet access, but you can go next door to use thiers." (By the way that's a charge of $5 for fifteen minutes next door). The maid did clean the room everyday but I wonder how well as there were dead "love" bugs on the wall the entire time we were there. At the end when we were checking out they charged a miscellaneous fee that I asked them to explain as we had prepaid for our stay of 10 days ahead of our arrival. The lady would not tell me and just said as she shrugged, "It's a miscellaneous charge." A $21.00 miscellaneous charge. The hotel is really close to everything and in a good location but just be aware!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've EVER been in!”
Reviews.Author: twinklings
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong - if you're used to musty, urine smelling old rooms this place is for you. It was barely tolerable and clean. I did not feel comfortable walking barefoot on the carpet or even in the shower, so I and my son wore flip-flops. There were tons of carpet stains and the toilet backed up. It was dreary and the remote control on the tv had tape to secure the batteries in. There is no elevator for the two floors - so if you have a young child, lugging the suitcase up the stairs is no fun. I will NOT, NOT, NOT be going back.

Reviews.Title: “not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: duduca
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the inn for 8 nights and enjoyed our stay. The room was clean and the pool was excellent. After reading some of the reviews we were concerned about what we could find there, but there was little to complain about. Every day the room was cleaned, the bed sheets and the towels replaced with clean ones. Did not see a bug in the room. Breakfast was not much to chose from: a cake, a cup of orange juice or apple juice and coffee, but we did not expect more for the price we paid. The parking lot seemed secured enough. The front desk people were friendly and polite. The location is close to the parks and there are plenty of restaurants and fast foods to chose from within walking distance. The gas station near the hotel offers good, cheap sandwiches, snacks and drinks. I did not like that the $ 2.50 per day was not disclosed to us before booking the room, that the little shampoo bottles appeared after 4 days in the bathroom. Not very pleased with the shuttle service. It's not flexible when it comes to the departure and return time; on the other hand, the bus stopped in another 4 or 5 places to pick up tourists. It took more than an hour to get to a theme park that is at maximum 5 miles distance from the inn. Costs a lot to do laundry: $4.00 to wash and dry a load of clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from This Place”
Reviews.Author: darkcloud
Reviews.Content: We arrived late friday evening (April 20th), and while the lady at the counter was friendly enough - there was a slight pushiness to get us to come back to get a "coupon book and a welcome" package. The beds were horrible - they BOTH bowed down as though they were the first beds installed when the hotel first opened. They were hard as a rock - the pillows were flimsy. The carpet was disgusting - you walk across it with bare feet and the bottom of your feet are BLACK because its so dirty. The bath tub's handrail was missing - the vent in the bathroom was filled with dust. The room was infested with those tiny little sugar ants. The hot water only came out in spurts between spurts of ice cold water. There is, NO BREAKFAST. The shuttle runs two times a day going to the park. IHOP, Shonneys, Waffle House are all within walking distance..and there is a Joe's Crab Shack across the highway if you can get to it on foot. We kept having to have our room keys re-programmed because they constantly kept going dead. This place is NOT a hotel...its a roach motel. Stay somewhere else - don't trust the good reviews. This place is awful.

Reviews.Title: “dont go”
Reviews.Author: greendogs222
Reviews.Content: I got into the hotel with my son sun morning at 1am. I didnt get into the room with my son till 3am. We ran up and down the stair looking for a non smoking room. Which we had to eventually have a security guard help us with our room. I never got a non smoking room. My room that I got was on the first floor I like that and the beds. WHat I didnt like was the cock roach that i saw ont the floor alive.THe run on the base of the bottom on the floors open. The security guard had to come in with bug spray and the fire alarm had to be disarmed by the security guard becaue it wouldnt stop going off. The staff was horrible. The lady that I dealt that late morning told me there was no contiental breakfast. so me and my son had to go to ihop which wasnt free for me and neither was shonneys. There wasnt anything for my son to do we had to walk over 2 miles to do fun things. I broke down and left monday night to a better rodeway inn in orlando which was 100 percent better.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: kumincir
Reviews.Content: Staff : Evening shift : Our flight arrived at 10.40pm, so it's almost midnight when we checked in. She wasnt informative, perhaps she's tired. What we asked, that's what she explained. Period.She pointed us a direction to our room, which lead us to a locked gate, and made us walked back again to lobby. When we explained about it, she just smiled and open the door behind her without say sorry and hold the door with her feet. Well, what do you expect from a budget hotel. Morning shift : No problem with them. They are okay. They allowed us to keep our backpacks in the room behind them. Room : I didnt expect much, just a place to sleep, because I knew we would be always come home late at night . So, when I did a little bit inspection, I was relieved to find it's clean, the lamps and tv are working, and there's no hair /bugs on my bed nor in the bathtub. They provided clean linens, enough towels for face/body/hand. There's no strange smell, and the water heater works fine. Shuttle : The hotel offers free shuttle from/to hotel- disney park, which is a combined shuttle bus with Howard Johnson guests.(The Howard Johnson hotel is right beside Rodeway Inn) . Dont rely on the shuttle much, because they are not always on time. They have 3 shuttles,in the morning, that goes in different time, from hotel to Magic Kingdom/Epcot, and 3 shuttles from the park , which are 6pm, 9.20pm and 10.30pm. It's said in the information paper, that we always had to check with the driver about the time . So on my first day , there's a young driver, he said we will be picked up from disney on 9.20pm. We were waiting and waiting . And the bus came at 10.30pm! Appearantly there's no 9.20 pm bus! But why were we told differently??? My suggestion is, if you want to use the free shuttle bus, use the first one in the morning from the hotel (7.30am), and use the last one (10.30pm) from magic kingdom back to hotel. The 7.30am bus is quite reliable and on time. We found out that there's a LYNX bus, number 56 that goes to Magic Kingdom. It comes every 15-20 minutes and $1.50 per trip. Just look for the pawn sign , about 10 meters to the left , in front of the hotel. It will just take 15 minutes to Magic Kingdom. If you're heading back to the hotel, you can ask the driver to stop at 'watermania ' . Then, you just walk across the street. Breakfast : Not much. It's a continental breakfast "eat on the go". And the meal is always same, muffin in the plastic, juice and coffee. For just a 99 cent , we got ourselves ham sandwich, from the store at gas station beside hotel. Props goes to the cleaning service guys. I left my hand phone when we already checked out , and immediately back to my room when I realized it on the way . The cleaning service people had already start cleaning the room when I was there . I told them I left my phone on the bed, and if they were seeing anything. One girl, went to her cleaning trolley and hand me the plastic bag with my hand phone in it. There's my room number written on it. I really appreciated the honesty .

Reviews.Title: “The city dump would be better!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Find another place to stay; this place is the pits!!! We stayed one night of the original four we had booked because we couldn't get out of there any sooner.
